ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Please rate how much you agree with each statement based on your experience: Following suggestions was hard
Please rate how much you agree with each statement based on your experience: I chose how to respond
Please rate how much you agree with each statement based on your experience: My experiences and actions felt self-generated
Please rate how much you agree with each statement based on your experience: I embraced the suggestions freely
Please rate how much you agree with each statement based on your experience: My experiences and actions were under my control
Please rate how much you agree with each statement based on your experience: I felt that my experiences and actions were not caused by me
Please rate how much you agree with each statement based on your experience: My experiences and actions occurred effortlessly
Please rate how much you agree with each statement based on your experience: I was mostly absorbed in what was going on
Please rate how much you agree with each statement based on your experience: My responses were involuntary
Please rate how much you agree with each statement based on your experience: I was reluctant to follow suggestions
Sense of Agency Rating Scale - Involuntariness Score
Notes: Sum of items 2, 3, 5, 6, 9. Note items 2, 3, and 5 are reverse-scored.

ElementDescription: Sense of Agency Rating Scale - Effortlessness Score
Notes: Sum of items 1, 4, 7, 8, 10. Note items 1 and 10 are reverse-scored.

ElementDescription: Sense of Agency Rating Scale - Total Score
Notes: Sum of items 1 through 10. Note items 1, 2, 3, 5, and 10 are reverse-scored.
